title: Life in Portugal
text:
Tasks






Passport





To re-new or get a new Indian Passport

Create an account on the Passport Seva webpage
Schedule an appointment by paying around Rupees 1500(Non-Tatkal)/3000(Tatkal).
Documents needed:

AADHAAR,
PAN card
2 Photos according to specifications.
Tatkaal/ Non Tatkaal
Tatkaal mode can get a passport wihtin a week, sometimes within 3days. Non-tatkaal takes a month.











Visa





You can get the necessary information at this VFS page. The Visa issued will have a validity of 4 months, during this period you are expected to get a residence permit. Here is a list of items you need for your application:






Visa Appointment





Know your Visa category before appointment. You may book the appointment the appointment from the VFS page.






Tip





If you are not able to book an appointment online. Contact the embassy for an appointment, or ask you host to contact the embassy for an appointment.












Visa category






Postdoc : D3/D4
Dependent Visa: DF










Police Clearance Certificate (PCC)






Book an appointment for from the Passport seva portal.
Carry you passport and AADHAAR card on the scheduled date and time to the designated PAssport seva kendra. - With a couple of Photographs. (refer to the webpage to be sure of all the necessary documents)
The police will come to your address to verfiy and typically you should get your PCC by post in 10 days(at most).










Means of Subsistance






Offer letter
Bank statement (Optional)










Flight Tickets





It takes around 15 days for the visa application to process and to get back your passport by mail. So, book you tickets accordingly.









Medical and Travel Insurance





The Visa you get will have a validity of 4 months. So, you are expected to get a policy for atleast 4 months.




Offer letter







Apostille






The Visa office expects certain documents like your PhD degree and marriage certificate to be apostilled.
Apostille is like an attestation process done by the Ministry of External Affairs(MEA) of India.







There are several services which you can find online based in Delhi which get this done for a fee of approximately 1000 Rupees per document.







2 Photos accordig to the Visa office’s specifications.







Tip





During the appointment check if you can also get an appointment for Residence permit in Portugal. In many cases, the visa issued would have a link of the appointment for Residence permit printed on it.



Please double-check this list with the check-list which is part of Visa application.









NIF





Tax identity is very important to do almost everything else in Portugal. For example: NISS, Contract, Apartment, Residence Permit, SNS, Bank Account etc.

Standing in line at early in the morning at your favourite Loja da Cidadao to get an appointment for later in the day.
Once you get the appointment, you host needs to be present during the appointment to vouch for you.







Tip






We showed up at the Loja da Cidadao at Saldanha at 4 AM and stood in line till 9 AM to get the appointment.
I heard the Loja at Larenjeiras is better. (Worth a try!)













FCUL contract






Your contract will be prepared by the office once you give them your NIF and a temporary address.
You need the signed contract for getting a Bank Account among other things.
After signing the contract, you need to get a bank account to get you salary which is ususally around 23rd of each month.










NISS





Social Security number. Getting this easy and not as stressful as getting NIF.
register for your NISS at this NISS webpage you will get an e-mail within a week with a phone number. You need to call the given number and book an appointment to collect your NISS document by hand at a ISS office.






The appointments in Lisbon city are not immediate. If it it is urgent, you can ask them for earliest appointmet in some far away place which they will be happy to suggest.












Residence Permit






Getiing an appointment for this is painful if you don’t already have one on your Visa.
Check your visa for a link which will take you to the SEF/AIMA webpage with an appointment.
Otherwise you need to call the AIMA and book an appointment when they are open. This might take a while.







Tip





If you search on facebook etc, you might find people who call and book and appointment on your behalf for a fee(could be around 300 euros).












Residence certificate issued by Junta de Fregusia






Apporoach your local Espaco Cidadao(these are different from Loja da Cidadao) with a filled in application and you would get it in a couple of days.
There are ways you could residence certificate Get two people who belong to the same parish to vouch for you.
Provide your utlities bills with your address as proof. This is needed for your residence permit.










SNS number





Servico Nacional de Saude









ADSE (health insurances)












Chave Movel












Banking











MB way















Transport











Metro












Gira















Apartment











Contract












Internet












Water












Electricity and Gass











Resources






Loja da Cidadao












Espaco Cidadao

title: Tulasimohan Molli
text:
Phone
  
  
    
     e-mail
  

  
  
I am a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Department of Mathematics at ULisboa, working under the supervision of Bruno Loff on the Hardness of Finding Good Algorithms (HoFGA) project. I am also a member of LASIGE, a research unit at the Faculty of Sciences, University of Lisbon (FCUL).
I obtained my PhD from Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR), Mumbai, under the guidance of Prahladh Harsha.



Circuit Complexity, Communication and Query Complexity, Analysis of Boolean functions, Data Structures.




PhD in Computer Science | 2023  Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Mumbai.
MSc in Computer Science | 2014  Chennai Mathematical Institute, Chennai.
BSc(Hons.) in Mathematics and Computer Science | 2012  Chennai Mathematical Institute, Chennai.

title: Criticality of DeMorgan formulae
text:
Welcome to this blog post on criticality in complex systems. In this post, we will explore the concept of criticality and its significance in understanding complex systems.


Criticality refers to the state of a system during a phase transition, where the system exhibits properties of both order and disorder. This concept is crucial in various fields such as physics, biology, and social sciences.





A phase transition is a transformation between different states of matter, such as from solid to liquid or liquid to gas. In complex systems, phase transitions can occur in various forms, leading to critical behavior.



Self-organized criticality (SOC) is a property of dynamical systems that naturally evolve to a critical state without external tuning. Examples of SOC include sandpile models, forest fires, and earthquakes.






In physics, criticality is studied in the context of phenomena like magnetism, superconductivity, and percolation theory.



In biology, criticality helps in understanding processes such as neural activity, gene regulation, and ecosystem dynamics.



In social sciences, criticality is used to analyze social networks, market dynamics, and collective behavior.




Understanding criticality in complex systems provides valuable insights into the behavior of various natural and artificial systems. By studying criticality, we can better predict and manage the behavior of these systems.
Thank you for reading this blog post. Feel free to leave your comments and questions below.

Date: 2023-10-05

title: Tulasimohan Molli
text:
by [[../people/Mihai Pǎtraşcu|Mihai Pǎtraşcu]] \newcommand{\G}{\mathbb{G}} \newcommand{\bD}{{\bf \Delta}} \newcommand{\abra}[1]{\langle #1 \rangle} \newcommand{\E}{\mathbb{E}}

[!note] [[../DS Problems/Partial Sums]] Let \G be a group. Data: Array A of length n with elements \in \G, Updates(k,\Delta): A[k] \leftarrow A[k] + \Delta Queries(k): \sum_{i=1}^k A[k]


Upper bound using [[Augmented binary trees]] of O(\log n).
Let \delta = \log |G|, they show a lower bound of \Omega(\frac{\delta}{w}\log n).


The Hard instance
A uniformly random (\Delta_1, \dots, \Delta_n) \in \G^n and \pi \in \G^n.
For t \leftarrow 1 to n, do Query(\pi(t)), Update (\pi(t),\Delta_t).

[!Definition] Information Transfer IT(t_0,t_1,t_2) is the collection of cells which were - read at time t_r \in [t_1,t_2] - written during t_w \in [t_0,t_1] and not in [t_w+1,t_2].

Let \bD = \abra{\bD_1, \dots ,\bD_n} be the random updates and \bD_{[t_0,t_1]} denote the the updates in the interval [t_0,t_1] and \Delta^* denote the rest of the updates. Let \alpha_{[t_1,t_2]} :=\abra{\alpha_{t_1},\dots, \alpha_{t_2}} be the answers to the queries in the second interval.

[!Lemma] Lemma 2 H(\alpha_{[t_1,t_2]}|\Delta^* = \bD^*) \leq w + 2w \cdot \E [IT(t_0,t_1,t_2)|\Delta^*=\bD^*]


[!Def] Interleave number IL(t_0,t_1,t_2)

title: Tulasimohan Molli
Tulasimohan Molli
Hardness of finding good Data Structuress
text:
2. Preliminaries

Data structures in the cell-probe model

[!def] Static Data Structure Problem (Static DSP) A Static Data Structure Problem is given by the tuple (D,Q,A,f) where - D is the domain of possible data, - Q is the domain of possible queries, - A is the set of possible answers and - f: Q \times D \to A is a map where f(x, y) is the answer to query x about data y. ^920054

The Cell Probe Model defined by Yao ~ is a deterministic model for Data Structures useful is proving lower bounds. In this model, the data is preprocessed and stored in s memory cells each capable of holding words of w bits. Each query is modelled as a decision tree which in each time step probes a memory location and based on the answer decides which location to probe next.
A solution with parameters s, b, and t is a method of storing any y \in D as a data structure \phi(y) in the memory of a random access machine, using s memory cells, each containing w bits, so that any query in Q can be answered by accessing at most t memory cells.

[!def] Solution/ Scheme (s,w,t) A (s,w,t) Solution to a Static Data Structure Problem (D,Q,f) is given by the tuple (s,t,\phi,\{Q_i\}) where - \phi: D \to [2^w]^s is an encoding map - Q_i is a decision tree of depth at most t for each query i \in Q. ^873ea3

Let P = (D,Q,f) be a DSP. Under some fixed ordering the Data Domain D and Query Domain, each Static DSP can be represented using a table called the whose rows are labelled by the queries from Q and the columns are labelled by the data points/datum from D.
Suppose the table has r = |D| rows and c = |D| columns, the is said to be r \times c.


What qualifies as a natural proof?


Communication Complexity
Communication complexity studies the number of bits of communication needed to compute a function in a game where the input is shared between the players. Typically the number of players is 2 unless specified oterwise.
In this model, the two players Alice and Bob are trying to compute a function f: X \times Y \to A. Alice gets an input x \in X and Bob gets an input y \in Y.

Protocol
Transcript
Protocol tree


[!def] Communication matrix Identify f with the matrix M with M_{x, y}= f (x, y); i.e., index the rows by Alice’s possible inputs, and the columns by Bob’s possible inputs.


Combinatorial rectangle
Rank
Discrepancy


Asymmetric Communication
Miltersen~ considered a Communication game from a Static Data Structure Problem to prove Static Data Structure lower bounds for Polynomial Evaluation. This technique was subsequently distilled and used by Miltersen, Nisan, Safra, Wigderson~ to prove lower bounds for other data structures.
Note that the inputs of Alice and Bob in the Miltersen’s game are not of the same length and typically Alice’s input is much smaller than Bob’s input.
In such a scenario, keeping track of the total communication is not very useful as it is bounded by Alice’s input length since Alice can send her input to Bob and Bob can compute the function. However, the problem still remains interesting if we restrict Alice’s communication.
Therefore, it is natural to track the communication of Alice and Bob seperately in the Asymmetric setting.
We keep track of the number of bits Alice sends to Bob and the number of bits Bob sends to Alice seperately.

[!def] [a,b]-protocol An [a, b]-protocol for f is a protocol where the total number of bits that Alice sends Bob is at most a and the total number of bits that Bob sends Alice is at most b. ^d55d28


[!def] [t,a,b]^A-protocol A [t, a, b]^A-protocol for f is a protocol where each of Alice’s messages contains at most a bits and each of Bob’s messages contains at most b bits and at most t messages are sent, with Alice sending the first message. A [t, a, b]^B protocol is defined similarly. ^7fea2b

[!def] (u,v)-richness A matrix M is (u, v)-rich if at least v columns contain at least u 1-entries. ^02c2c8 A communication problem f is (u,v)-rich if iff its Communication matrix M_f is (u,v)-rich.


[!lem] Lemma 5 Richness lemma Let f be a (u, v)-rich problem. If f has a deterministic [a, b]-protocol, then f contains a submatrix of dimensions at least u/2^{a+2} \times v^{a+b+2} containing only 1-entries. ^09a188

text:
5.Is there a natural proofs barrier against dynamic data-structure lower-bounds?

5.1 Preliminaries on dynamic data structures
\newcommand{\N}{\mathbb{N}} >[!def] Update Graph >Let m \in \N. >An update graph with m updates is a directed graph where every node v has out-degree U, and each outgoing edge from v is >uniquely labelled in [U]. Given a node v, and a number i \in [m], we let u_i(v) be the node such that (v, u_i(v)) has label i. W >say w = u_i(v) is obtained from v by applying the i-th update.
^f8ad12
\newcommand{\ZO}{\{0,1\}}

[!def] Skeleton The of a dynamic data-structure problem is a tuple (n, m, G), where n \in \N is the number of queries, m \in \N is the number of updates, and G is an update graph with m updates.
Given a skeleton S = (n, m, G), a with skeleton S, is a map T: V(G) \times [n] \to \ZO. For v \in V(G), we write q_i(v) = T(v,i). Then, a Boolean dynamic data-structure problem is a tuple P = (n, m, G, T), where (n,m,G) is a skeleton and T a table.

^abe5f1

[!def] Dynamic Data Structure Problem P = (n,M,G,T)

^714b4c
Let P = (n,m,G,T) be a dynamic data structure problem.

[!def] Dynamic Data Structure Scheme A (history-independent) , or , for P is a tuple A = (w,s,t_u, t_q, E,\{U_i\},\{Q_i\}), where: - E:V(G) \to (\ZO^w)^s is called the . - w \in \N is called the , and s \in \N is called the of the solution. - t_u \in \N is called the , and t_q \in \N the . - \{ Q_i \mid i \in [n] \} is a collection of decision-trees over (\ZO^w)^s, of depth \le t_q. - The decision-trees Q_i perform queries: forall v \in V(G), i \in [n], Q_i(E(v)) = q_i(v). - \{U_i \mid i \in [m]\} is a collection of read/write decision-trees over (\ZO^w)^s (i.e., over s-long words over a w-bit alphabet), of depth \le t_u. - The read-write decision-trees U_i perform updates on the encodings: for all v \in V(G), i \in [m], U_i(E(v)) = E(u_i(v)).

^342e98

[!def] Relaxed Scheme A , or , is a tuple A = (w,s,t_u, t_q, E,\{Q_i\}), where: - w,s,t_u,t_q,E and \{Q_i\} are as items 1-5 above. - But the updates do not need to be efficiently implementable by read-write decision trees. Instead, we only require that, for every v \in V(G), the Hamming distance between E(v) and E(u_i(v)) is at most t_u. (This is always the case for a normal solution.)

^ba649f

title: Tulasimohan Molli
text:
2D Range Counting

[!DSP] 2D Range Counting #static_DSP Data Domain: Given a set P of n points in the 2D plane and Query Domain: a query rectangle R (defined by its bottom-left and top-right corners), f(x,y) the 2D range counting problem asks to determine the number of points in P that lie within R.

This is also sometimes referred to as Orthogonal Range Counting.
Upper Bounds:

O(n log n) preprocessing, O(log n) query time: Using a 2D range tree. This is a classic data structure approach. (Bentley, 1975; Lueker, 1978; Willard, 1978). Several variations exist with slightly different preprocessing/query tradeoffs.
O(n) preprocessing, O(√n) query time: Using kd-trees. This offers a good balance, especially for lower dimensions. (Bentley, 1975)
O(n log n/log log n) preprocessing, O(log n/log log n) query time (expected): Using range trees combined with fractional cascading. (Chazelle and Guibas, 1986). This represents a slight theoretical improvement over standard range trees.
O(m) preprocessing, O(n/√m) query time: Using the batched range counting technique for m queries. This approach is useful when dealing with many queries at once. (Chazelle, 1988)
O(n polylog n) preprocessing, O(logε n) query time (approximate counting): For a (1+ε)-approximation. Allows for significantly faster queries at the cost of some error. (Arya and Mount, 2000)

Lower Bounds:

Ω(log n/log log n) query time: Under the pointer machine model. (Chazelle, 1990) This indicates that, up to polylogarithmic factors, the range tree with fractional cascading is close to optimal in this model.
Ω(√n) query time (for linear space): Under the algebraic decision tree model. (Fredman, 1982) This implies that kd-trees are near-optimal for linear

title: Tulasimohan Molli

[!DSP] Partial Match #static_DSP - D is the set of subsets y \subseteq \{0,1\}^n, - Q is set of elements x \in \{0, 1\}^n - f(x,y): \exists z \in y \ \forall i \in [n]: x_i \leq z_i.

[[Patrascu Unifying the landscape.canvas|Patrascu Unifying the landscape]] obtains current best non-trivial LB.
The best previous bound [[Cell-probe lower bounds for the partial match problem|Jayram, Khot, Kumar, Rabani ’03]] for Alice’s communication was \Omega(d/ \log n) bits, instead of our optimal \Omega(d).
Prior work: - [[Lower bounds for high dimensional nearest neighbor search and related problems|Lower bounds for high dimensional nearest neighbor search and related problems]] by Bordoin, Ostrovsky, Rabani 1999 - [[Cell-probe lower bounds for the partial match problem|Cell-probe lower bounds for the partial match problem]] by Jayram, Khot, Kumar, Rabani 2003 - [[../Notes/Miltersen, Nisan, Safra, Wigderson|Miltersen, Nisan, Safra, Wigderson]] 1998 - [[Higher lower bounds for near-neighbor and further rich problems]] by Patrascu, Thorup 2006

Communication Game

[!theorem] Theorem 1.1. [Citation?] Let Alice hold a string in \{0, 1,*\}^d, and let Bob hold n points in \{0, 1\}^d. In any bounded-error protocol answering the partial match problem, either Alice sends \Omega(d) bits or Bob sends \Omega(n^{1−\epsilon}) bits, for any constant \epsilon > 0.

By the standard relation between asymmetric communication complexity and cell-probe data structures [[../Notes/Miltersen, Nisan, Safra, Wigderson|MNSW’98]] and decision trees [[Hardness of Nearest Neighbor under L-infinity|Andoni, Croitoru, Patrascu ’08]], this bounds implies that - a data structure for the partial match problem with cell-probe complexity t must use space 2^{\Omega(d/t)}, assuming the word size is O(n^{1−\epsilon}/t); - a decision tree for the partial match problem must have size 2^{\Omega(d)}, assuming the depth is O(n^{1−2\epsilon}/d) and the predicate size is O(n^\epsilon).

title: Reachability in Butterfly Graphs
text:
[!DSP] Reachability preprocess a sparse directed graph in less than n^2 space, such that reachability queries (can u be reached from v?) are answered efficiently


Reachability in Butterfly Graphs

First lower bound for reachability.


[!theorem] Theorem 1.2. A reachability oracle using space S in the cell-probe model with w-bit cells requires query time \Omega(\log n/ \log (Sw /n) ).


bound is true even for Butterfly Graphs.
bound is tight in this special case
